name: stained glass and leadlight
sizes_available: small (60 sts), medium (72 sts), large (84 sts)
notes:
**___**
**___**

<big><big><big>**stained glass and leadlight**</big></big></big>
<big>i’m guessing you have leftover yarn from previous projects like i do, and who doesn’t need a pattern to help use them up?</big>

<big>the design reminded me of a leadlight surrounded doorway that i had seen in an article about the historic theebine hotel in queensland, australia.</big>

<big>this is a fun and easy design.</big>
<big>these stranded colourwork socks are worked toe up with a rounded wedge toe and with a heel flap and gusset.</big>

**___**
**___**

<big>**pattern information**</big>

<big>**sizing**</big>
adult – small (medium, large) – s-60 (m-72, l-84) sts.
finished circumference (approx) – 16.5 (20, 23.5) cm/6.75 (8, 9.25) inches.

<big>**yarn**</big>
fingering weight sock yarn in 2 (or more) colours with good contrast.
allow 60-80 g for mc and 40-60 g for cc.  each chart repeat uses between 3-5 g of cc for a pair of socks.

<big>**gauge**</big>  (worked in the round and measured after washing and laying flat to dry) 
36 sts/40 rounds = 10 cm/4 inches over stranded colourwork.

<big>**needles**</big>  (for working small circumference in the round) 
2.25 mm/us1 needles (or size required to achieve gauge).

<big>**pattern formats** </big>
the instructions for the construction of the socks are written and the colourwork pattern is both charted and written.

a low vision accessible version of this pattern are also available. this version includes 24 point arial all black text, no italics, no columns or tables and fully written instructions. there are charts included but the charts are not needed to complete the pattern.
